meanings.definition: A small, red berry that grows in clusters on a plant.
meanings.sent1: The forest floor was dotted with bunchberries, their bright red color standing out.
meanings.sent2: She picked a handful of bunchberries to add to her salad for a pop of color.
meanings.sent3: The bunchberries whispered to each other, 'Who will be the juiciest of us all?'
meanings.sent4: The bunchberries were like little drops of blood on the green canvas of the forest floor.
meanings.sent5: The birds feasted on the bunchberries, leaving behind only empty stems.

meanings.definition: A group or cluster of bunchberries.
meanings.sent1: The children found a bunch of bunchberries growing near the stream.
meanings.sent2: The basket was filled with a colorful bunch of bunchberries, ready for jam-making.
meanings.sent3: The bunchberries huddled together, telling stories of their adventures in the forest.
meanings.sent4: The bunchberries looked like a tiny army ready to march across the forest floor.
meanings.sent5: The bunch of bunchberries seemed to glow in the soft light of the setting sun.
